options: Eat a variety of fruits and vegetables

hints.Eat a variety of fruits and vegetables: Aim for at least five servings per day to ensure you get plenty of vitamins, minerals, and fiber.
hints.Choose whole grains: Opt for whole grain bread, pasta, and rice instead of refined grains to get more nutrients and fiber.
hints.Stay hydrated: Drink plenty of water throughout the day to help your body function properly.
hints.Limit sugary drinks: Choose water, milk, or 100% fruit juice instead of sodas, energy drinks, or sugary fruit drinks.
hints.Eat lean proteins: Include sources like chicken, fish, beans, and tofu to help build and repair muscles.
hints.Choose healthy snacks: Opt for fruits, vegetables, whole grain crackers, or yogurt instead of candy or chips.
hints.Don't skip breakfast: Eating a nutritious breakfast helps provide energy and focus for the day ahead.
hints.Eat mindfully: Pay attention to your body's hunger and fullness cues to avoid overeating.
hints.Limit processed foods: Cut back on pre-packaged meals and snacks, which can be high in unhealthy fats, sugar, and sodium.
hints.Enjoy healthy fats: Include sources like avocados, nuts, and seeds to support brain development and overall health.
hints.Cut back on added sugars: Limit sweets and desserts, and choose healthier alternatives like fruit when possible.
hints.Get calcium for strong bones: Include dairy products or calcium-fortified alternatives like almond milk to support growing bones.
hints.Learn to read food labels: Understand the nutritional content of the foods you eat to make healthier choices.
hints.Practice portion control: Eat age-appropriate serving sizes to maintain a healthy weight and avoid overeating.
